newsitem.title: USA: Broadway & Seymour expects breakeven Q4 '96.
newsitem.headline: Broadway & Seymour expects breakeven Q4 '96.

text.p: Broadway & Seymour Inc said Thursday that based on preliminary unaudited fourth quarter 1996 results, it expects to break even for the period.
Alan Stanford, chairman and chief executive, said the company has met its plans to break even, after three quarters of refocusing and rationalization.
The company reported a $1.84 per share loss in 1995's fourth quarter.

"We believe that the transformation undertaken in 1996 is now essentially complete and, based on the facts and circumstances known at this time, we expect profitable operations with continually improving quarterly progress throughout 1997," he said.
The sotfware and services company said it expects that its final fourth quarter and fiscal 1996 audited results will be completed and released in mid-February.
